comment.body: For some reason, when I use that search box I can never find the ZeroMe posts *on ZeroMe itself*, only on Peeper.
@FraYoshi: Do you know if there is a way to cap 0net's bandwidth usage?

@Shiruka:
+ [ZeroUp Unlimited](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1CiXRY9ATZSoZqBzwMfXEMsKtPRt2aQoF2/)
+ [IFS](http://127.0.0.1:43110/12MVkvYGcRW6u2NYbpfwVad1oQeyG4s9Er)
+ If it's video, [KopyKate](http://127.0.0.1:43110/big.kopykate.bit/) allows very large files.
-
Posts with some info on [uploading to IFS](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1Ctjcvfovq6d1JWEGvM1JovCym4H6Es33L/?Post:10:Experimenting+with+uploads:+audio) and [uploading to KopyKate](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1Ctjcvfovq6d1JWEGvM1JovCym4H6Es33L/?Post:8:Experimenting+with+uploads:+video).
@Shiruka: That's good to know. I've added it to the [wiki](http://127.0.0.1:43110/138R53t3ZW7KDfSfxVpWUsMXgwUnsDNXLP/?Page:file-sharing)
@leftside: I had no idea what Initial D was, but the live action film was just put on Netflix, so I've added it to my list.
@leftside: I used ZeroMe Unfuck to change hubs (to get on one with more space for user content). As others said, make a backup and try it. Worked for me :)

@Pubg: & @60: I believe it's because the bracket types are the wrong way around: square brackets should be around the text to display, round brackets around the URL.
+ `[me](http://21f:dd73:7cdb:773b:a924:7ec0:80)`
+ [me](http://21f:dd73:7cdb:773b:a924:7ec0:80)

@wrewolf: You can also just post the URL by itself and it will become a clickable link once your post is published, e.g.:
http://127.0.0.1:43110/1NEuAUKgUoY6fnXeXBaonjrDfNbfpQpdMp/ (URL for one of my blogs)
.
More on Markdown formatting for things like links etc.
+ [Glightstar's blog - Markdown guide](http://127.0.0.1:43110/lightstar.bit/?P:2)
+ [ZeroWiki - Markdown](http://127.0.0.1:43110/138R53t3ZW7KDfSfxVpWUsMXgwUnsDNXLP/?Page:markdown)
@ssdifnskdjfnsdjk@zeroid.bit: How does one find boards on Millchan Engine? Is there a list anywhere?

@Pexo: Thanks.
The list is a bit mysterious (mostly just letters) but if there's anything I really don't want on my hard drive, presumably I can just Delete and Blacklist on a per-hub basis.
